group_1.textRight: I tasked you with eliminating the Taito Gang,
but I see you've returned in defeat.

group_1.textLeft: I will not make any excuses before you,@my liege.

group_1.textRight: What shall I do now…?
By deploying all the soldiers we did and losing,
we've humiliated ourselves before the others,@and our vassals will question our competence.
I fear everything my father has built will@crumble to nothing…

group_1.textLeft: Fret not.
I've already taken action as the lord of Kumai.
I guarantee you will be able to restore@your dignity, my liege.

group_1.textRight: Then I place my hopes in you, Lord Kumai.

group_1.textLeft: Yes, sir.
Great, great…we're still making progress.

group_1.textRight: It seems that playing the magpie is working@to our advantage.

group_1.textLeft: When I saw the two of them on the ground@like that, I thought it was all over.
But since Iroha's concept is still being recovered,@it means history is still right on track.

group_1.textRight: Rejoice, Tsuruno!

group_1.textLeft: [chara:100301:effect_emotion_surprise_0][se:7226_shock]W-w-what's going on?!

group_1.textRight: We were finally able to make contact with@the Taito Gang through their messenger!

group_1.textLeft: Really?! What did they say?!

group_1.textRight: Father chose to invite Saemon Banshu to the@castle to confirm the veracity of the letter.

group_1.textLeft: No way!
This is all thanks to Sana for going over there@and convincing Chizuru!
Oh, but…is it really okay?
They'll have to cross enemy territory@in small numbers…

group_1.textRight: It seems they prefer that to revealing@the location of their stronghold.
I received word that Chizuru will be joining@them, so I'm sure Sana will return to us as well.
I'm sure that pleases you, Tsuruno.

group_1.textLeft: …Yeah, it looks like we'll be reunited safely.
When I was a young lad, my grandfather@regaled me of fairy tales long past…
…in which Mizuna, Suitoku, and Taito gathered@before the sacred tree and swore an oath.
This letter is evidence of that…and we have@sinned in forgetting it.
Please…do forgive us.

group_1.textRight: That was hundreds of years ago. It deserves@to be swept away with time.
You were better off tearing that letter@to shreds.
My only ambition is to live in leisure,@protecting the land of my ancestors.
Unlike you samurai, I have no interest@in territory or power.

group_1.textLeft: I refuse to partake in such greed as well.
Back to the point.@Your daughter preserved that letter,
and mine brought us together.
...So you think we should join forces, is that it?

group_1.textRight: Dad…don't start a fight…!

group_1.textLeft: I don't want to form an alliance with you.
Still, we share the same desire to protect@our people together.
I hope someday we'll join up and restore@our country to as it once was.

group_1.textRight: But why not now…?!
We carried out an invasion during a famine,@and the territories are now exhausted.
If we and Taito were to ally with each other,@we would be branded as traitors…

group_1.textLeft: Just as you said, Princess.
If Mizuna were to side with us, people would@immediately grow suspicious.

group_1.textRight: I don't really get it…but I guess that's just@the way things are.

group_1.textLeft: This will be the last time we meet, then.

group_1.textRight: Fine by me, but we still want knowledge@of any happenings around us.

group_1.textLeft: Then we'll agree to send messengers@to each other.

group_1.textRight: Father, shouldn't we be having this@conversation with Gen'un?
The Suitoku were the third pillar of the country@in ancient times, after all.

group_1.textLeft: I would have liked that, but Saemon Banshu@wanted to assess the situation first.

group_1.textRight: What for?

group_1.textLeft: Suitoku Temple has grown much too powerful@compared to the old days.

group_1.textRight: But they're also pursuing ways to save people@through promoting the debt moratorium.

group_1.textLeft: And just who was it that spread rumors of us@controlling Demons?

group_1.textRight: That's…

group_1.textLeft: Little girl, I know you and Gen'un of Suitoku@are good friends,
but you must consider our perspective as well.

group_1.textRight: …My apologies.
I'm glad Mizuna and Taito are friends now…!

group_1.textLeft: It's a huge success for us in two ways!

group_1.textRight: What's the other way?

group_1.textLeft: We avoided a time paradox!

group_1.textRight: What on earth does that mean…?

group_1.textLeft: Don't worry about it. It just means things@are playing out as they should.

group_1.textRight: Personally, I'm just glad Sana could return@to you guys so quickly. It'll really save her hide.

group_1.textLeft: What do you mean by that?

group_1.textRight: Um, no, it's just…
Although being invisible was good@for infiltration…
She missed out on meals and kept running@into all sorts of difficulties.
Look, I had no idea who you were.@It's not my job to babysit a Battle Shamaness.

group_1.textLeft: I'm sorry…

group_1.textRight: The least you can do is take care of your@own flunkies, Tsuyu.

group_1.textLeft: Erm…I'm sorry, too…
If not for the Rumor's power, Sana might@have been cast out altogether.

group_1.textRight: Yeah…it was a really big help…

group_1.textLeft: Speaking of meals, how's the Taito Gang been@doing with the famine?

group_1.textRight: Although this was a bad year for crops, I think@they have enough reserves to survive.
They also have those financial resources that@the Sumiya and the others were after…

group_1.textLeft: Enough to last?

group_1.textRight: Chizuru said they can manage for at least@a year or two.

group_1.textLeft: In any case, it seems like you two magpies@have played your role well.

group_1.textRight: Hey, what's this book?

group_1.textLeft: The Tale of the Heike.
I love the Kōwakamai dance, so I'm reading this@to learn the original story.
Would you like to read it, too, Chizuru?

group_1.textRight: I can't read. Tell me the story instead, Tsuyu.

group_1.textLeft: Heavens, no, it's much too long for that!
